reviews.review_text: Really truly saved my skin after testing out Dr Brandts hydro biotic cream which hoooo boy did a number in my face. I don't have particularly sensitive skin (I use actives, acids, etc pretty often) but I broke out in small savage clusters that I couldn't tame. It made me seriously avoid any product that had dimethicone as top 3 ingredient (jury is still out whether this ingredient is truly bad for your face but I had to weed out something to see what was wrong) Cue this balm. Not only did it help calm down the stubborn broken out areas but my goddd does it make your skin feel amazing. I woke up with plump, velvety smooth skin the next day. Like wow no other high end moisturizer has done this for me. Dry/combo skin who?   It's a balm but more of a gooey consistency (maybe like honey but not sticky), not a balm you have to scrape out. It spreads out easily from just a little dab. It 'melts' into skin but I wouldn't say it totally disappears instantly, which I like my moisturizers to do because I feel like it creates a little bit of a moisture locking barrier. Plays well with makeup, as well as other things I might add to it like retinol or AHA.  I stan for how REN avoids all the no-nos in skin care. I will repurchase the balm for sure, and because I enjoyed it so much I will definitely be trying out other products in their line. They have a customer for life after just one week of use!

reviews.review_text: So this review is for all of you lovely people who love a terribly long review, and for those of you who don't, I'm sorry. Here is a short version: I love it. Buy it. Now. So the back story: for a long while I told myself I didn't need this. Why do you need it? It's simply an oil. You have oils. Or it's like an overnight mask. You have those too. But I had some extra money and decided to splurge and OH MY GOODNESS GRACIOUS MASHED POTATOES (sorry) NOW I CAN NEVER GO BACK. I use this maybe once a week (okay, maybe twice a week) on nights when my skin is just feeling dull and achy (can skin feel achy?) and I want a little more oomph than the oils can give me (because you know I am going to bed looking like an oil slick so in the morning I look like the goddess I am-I mean, I'm not alone, right?) and boy, oh BOI, does this deliver. It feels beautiful, first of all. It really is like a balm-to-oil texture that is heavenly. You warm it up in your fingers and press it into your skin and it really does an amazing job of recovering your skin from whatever you might have put it through that day / week. I highly HIGHLY recommend this (obviously) and even for all skin types. Because, while I lean on the dry side, I am a firm believer in oily-skinned using oils to keep their oils at bay. I hope that makes sense. Cheers to you if you've made it to the end of this long review! Now go buy this balm!

reviews.review_title: Super sad to have to say this but..
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was really really excited about this balm. I've never used a skincare product with virtually NO bad reviews so I was pretty hyped to receive it. My skin isn't terribly sensitive, and it's mostly combination. Living in the Midwest during these harsh winter months it tends to be dry more often than not. I really hate overpowering my skin with thick creams that tend to sit on the surface so I thought this would finally be the one. It wasn't.  When I started using it a few weeks ago I noticed that I was waking up with strange breakouts mostly on my forehead (where I never get breakouts) and cheeks. It 'kind of' seemed like an irritation since it was a large patch of small bumps but then there were a few big ones mixed in that took a couple of days to go away. I stopped using it for about a week until my skin was clear again then gave it another shot. The exact same thing happened again the first night, but I continued to use it every other day for another week or two hoping maybe my skin just needed to adjust to a new formula. My forehead got pretty out of control so I stopped using it all together and everything cleared up.  I also have to say that I wasn't a huge fan of the sticky residue it left on my skin. I know a few people have said that their skin absorbed it well but that definitely wasn't the case for me, even when using it sparingly.  It seems that this may work well for other skin types but for mine it just didn't seem to agree. I'm giving 2 stars because I do feel bad giving only 1 when it does seem to be a great product for so many others.
